Comment 6: 
I have already made a detailed study and list of all the Unix-like system dependencies
in Go. I identified all of the items you mentioned--and more--including the issue of
lazy and cached writes. That's why I starred issue #848 as a test case. All non-portable
references to /tmp, /etc/passwd, /dev/urandom, et cetera, are marked for extinction.

Does this patch work?
Attachments: 1. issue848.diff (380 bytes)
